Engine.Task

Package
Description
Engine
 

  • Uses of Task in Engine

    Classes in Engine that implement Task
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    TaskScheduler.ForEachTask<T>
    Represents a SchedulerTask for iterating over an array of data elements.
    class 
    TaskScheduler.ForTask
    Represents a SchedulerTask for iterating a specific number of times.
    class 
    TaskScheduler.SchedulerTask
    Represents a task that can be scheduled and executed by the TaskScheduler.
    class 
    TaskScheduler.SchedulerTaskParam<T>
    Represents a SchedulerTask with a parameter.

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description

    TaskScheduler.taskStack
     
    Methods in Engine that return Task
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <T> Task
    Task.forEach(double seconds, T[] data, Consumer<T> x)
    Executes the given Consumer for each element in the provided array, with a delay of the specified number of seconds between each execution.
    Task
    Task.forIter(double seconds, int iterations, Consumer<Integer> x)
    Executes the given Consumer for the specified number of iterations, with a delay of the specified number of seconds between each execution.
    Task
    Task.sleep(double seconds, TaskScheduler.lambda x)
    Sleeps for the specified number of seconds and then executes the given lambda expression.
    <T> Task
    Task.sleep(double seconds, Consumer<T> x, T data)
    Sleeps for the specified number of seconds and then executes the given Consumer with the provided data.
    <T> Task
    TaskScheduler.SchedulerTask.sleep(double seconds, Consumer<T> x, T data)
    Creates and schedules a new SchedulerTask with the specified delay, consumer function, and data.
